intro: Adenoncos buruensis, commonly known as the Buru adenoncos, is a rare and endemic species found in the tropical rainforests of Indonesia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Adenoncos buruensis is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and deforestation.
